findings.description: Clones.cloneDeterministic deploys the pool before initialization. If initialize reverts (e.g., invalid sqrtPriceX96), the transaction reverts after deployment, leaving an uninitialized clone at the deterministic address. An attacker can then initialize it, preventing legitimate users from registering the pool as subsequent initializations fail, blocking official pool creation for that token pair and tick spacing.
findings.reasoning: This finding meets all the strict criteria for a valid vulnerability: 1) It describes a concrete exploit where an attacker can hijack pool addresses and block official registration. 2) It does not require a compromised trusted role. 3) There is no existing mitigation in the code. 4) The vulnerability is in the analyzed contract. 5) It is not a design choice but an unintentional flaw. 6) It has a material impact as it can block pool creation.

target_assessment.type_match_reasoning: The target vulnerability was not mentioned in the analysis.

notes: The analysis identified a valid denial-of-service vulnerability but did not identify the target vulnerability related to the fee configuration issue.
